definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: It's a great movie if you want to know about actors.
sentences.chinese: 一部好片啊，丫想了解戲子的話。

sentences.english: So I'm fated to be an actor.
sentences.chinese: 所以我註定了也是一個戲子。

sentences.english: We are all actresses, Will only for other people's stories cry .
sentences.chinese: 我們都是戲子只會爲別人的故事流淚。

sentences.english: "Opera jokery" is a traditional derogatory term for actors.
sentences.chinese: “戲子”就是傳統上對演員的鄙稱。
一個戲子參與了這一切。

definition: to pretend to look happy/to force oneself to smile
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
wind, flower, snow and moon, trite poetry subject (idiom); effete language without substance/love affair/romance is in the air/dissipated life
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
interlude/to cross the stage/to do sth as a mere formality/to go through the motions
to enjoy the present (idiom); to live happily with no thought for the future/make merry while you can/carpe diem
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
